People will take different things away from the experience. Some will learn how to work with others and how to be a team player. Others will learn that they prefer to keep to themselves in life. I have learned a lot in school. For me it was just learning about myself primarily, but that was important. I learned that I like to take a different path than most. I like to do things my own way. That's what makes me happy. I'm not someone who wants to be defined by a specific title or job. People can't always understand that, but I'm okay with that.

So I think the most important thing to learn in school overall is about who you are. It's about learning how to be yourself and not worry about what others think. It helps to shape you into becoming your own unique person. School is important but not for the reason many people may think. It goes beyond just the books.
